bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George E. Armstrong, September 29, 1952

div1.p: Hench writes to Armstrong that he has just received a cable from Nogueira informing him that the dedication of Camp Lazear has been postponed until December 3, 1952. Hench is concerned that Finlay will overshadow the American Yellow Fever Commission because December 3 is Finlay's birthday and "Physicians' Day" in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George E. Armstrong, September 29, 1952
div1.opener:
September 29, 1952 REF: MEDDA 619.3 (Camp Lazear) C
General George E. Armstrong
The Surgeon General
Department of the Army
Washington 25, D. C.
My dear General Armstrong:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your letter of September 24 with the correction
of James Hanberry's middle name. I have just received a cable from Dr.
Pedro Nogueira of Marianao, Havana, stating that the dedication of
Camp Lazear is being postponed until presumably December 3.

The delays that I anticipated have occurred. The construction of the
park and adjoining street will not be finished until November. The
medallions for Finlay, Delgado, Wood, Reed, Carroll, Lazear and Agramonte
are being founded in bronze. Doctor Nogueira and his associates are
about to order the bronze plaques on which the volunteers names will
appear.

I am a little concerned. As a second choice, Doctor Nogueira had hoped
to dedicate the Camp on November 20 as that was the day in 1900 when the
Camp was originally opened for business, but Doctor Nogueira's colleagues
preferred to dedicate it on December 3 which is Finlay's birth date and
also seems to be “Physicians Day in Cuba.” It would appear to me that
there is an excellent chance to have Finlay overshadow the American Yellow
Fever Commission but, as you know, I have expected that all along.

I have written to Doctor Nogueira expressing to him my hope that the
changed date might make it possible for you to accept an official in-
vitation when it is forthcoming. Will you permit me to hope that you
might be able to attend, assuming that the date is now set for Decem-
ber 3?
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
